mods.note: IMWAKP j TKLBGRAIvI riluyb# SECRET 1335 (if in any case the comirAudlua4We contents ^ of this document to any person outside Government Stezfce is authorised, it must be paraphrased). Allotted to * Wv EjgTOrnal Copies circulated . a y p h a r From Department , TEL E O R A M Government of India* External Affairs Dept. To Secretary of State for India. Dated New Delhi* 30.15 hours, 18th January 1943* Received 18.45 hours* 13th January 1943,, IMMEDIATE . No.361 . Addressed Secretary of State for India repeated to Angora. Turkish Mission. In the interests of security we Intend to apply the usual censorship at New Delhi massages sent by Mission, normally applying restrictions with no less liberty than to representatives of British and American journals. We must however realise that Axis interests may be represented on Mission and special scrutiny may be needed. 3c If -H.M.G. have any special instructions based on their own experience of Turkish Mission to U.K. we shquld be glad to have them.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 271/43 Censorship of messages sent by Turkish mission in New Delhi

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 3; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a telegram from the Government of India, External Department, to the Secretary of State for India, informing that restrictions were applied to the messages sent by the Turkish mission in New Delhi.

name.namePart: Secretary of State for India and Burma, United Kingdom
Indian Political Service, External Affairs Department
